title: Egg Manchurian
preparation: Boil eggs, remove shell, and cut into halves.
Mix corn flour, all-purpose flour, salt, and water to make a batter.
Dip egg halves in the batter and deep fry until golden brown.
In a separate pan, heat oil and sauté ginger, garlic, and green chilies.
Add soy sauce, tomato ketchup, vinegar, and salt. Cook for a few minutes.
Add fried eggs and mix well. Serve hot.

title: Chicken Biryani
preparation: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, biryani masala, mint leaves, coriander leaves, and salt.
Cook basmati rice separately and keep aside.
In a pan, heat ghee and oil. Sauté onions until golden brown.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add marinated chicken and cook until tender.
Layer cooked rice over the chicken mixture.
Cover and cook on low heat until the flavors blend. Serve hot.

title: Dal Tadka
preparation: Pressure cook lentils until soft.
In a pan, heat ghee. Add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, onions, green chilies, ginger, and garlic. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for a minute.
Add cooked lentils and salt. Cook for a few minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

title: Palak Paneer
preparation: Blanch spinach in hot water, drain, and blend into a smooth paste.
In a pan, heat oil. Add cumin seeds, onions, green chilies, ginger, and garlic. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook for a minute.
Add spinach paste and cook for a few minutes.
Add paneer cubes, cream, and salt. Cook for another few minutes. Serve hot.

title: Gulab Jamun
preparation: Mix milk powder, all-purpose flour, and baking powder in a bowl.
Add ghee and milk to form a smooth dough.
Shape the dough into small balls.
Heat ghee in a pan and fry the balls until golden brown.
In a separate pan, make a syrup with sugar, water, cardamom powder, and saffron strands.
Soak the fried balls in the syrup for a few hours. Serve warm.

title: Aloo Gobi
preparation: Cut potatoes and cauliflower into small florets.
In a pan, heat oil. Add cumin seeds, onions, green chilies, ginger, and garlic. Sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook for a minute.
Add potatoes and cauliflower. Mix well.
Cover and cook until vegetables are tender. Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot.

title: Orange Juice
preparation: Peel oranges and remove seeds.
Blend oranges to extract juice.
Strain the juice to remove pulp.
Serve chilled.

title: Mutton Curry
preparation: Marinate mutton with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt.
In a pan, heat oil. Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add marinated mutton and cook until tender.
Garnish with coriander leaves. Serve hot.

title: Samosas
preparation: Make a dough with all-purpose flour, water, and salt. Rest the dough for some time.
Boil, peel, and mash potatoes.
In a pan, heat oil. Add cumin seeds, onions, ginger, green chilies, and sauté until onions are golden brown.
Add green peas, mashed potatoes, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for a few minutes.
Roll out small portions of the dough into circles. Fill each circle with the potato mixture and shape into triangles.
Deep fry the samosas until golden brown. Serve hot with chutney.

title: Pani Puri
preparation: Make a dough with semolina, all-purpose flour, baking soda, and water. Rest the dough for some time.
Boil, peel, and mash potatoes.
Blend green chilies, mint leaves, coriander leaves, tamarind, dates, jaggery, chaat masala, and salt to make a spicy water.
Roll out small portions of the dough into small circles and fry until crisp.
Make a hole in the center of each fried puri and fill with a mixture of potatoes, chickpeas, and boondi.
Dip the filled puris in the spicy water and serve immediately.

title: Idiyappam
ingredients: Mixed vegetables (such as carrot, beans, potato, drumstick)
preparation: Cook toor dal in a pressure cooker until soft and mushy.
In a separate pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds. Once they splutter, add asafoetida, curry leaves, and dry red chilies.
Add mixed vegetables and sauté for a few minutes.
Add tamarind pulp, sambar powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.

title: Aloo Paratha
preparation: Knead whole wheat flour with water to make a soft dough. Rest the dough for 15-20 minutes.
Mix boiled and mashed potatoes with finely chopped green chilies, cumin seeds, coriander leaves, and salt to make the stuffing.
Divide the dough into small balls. Roll out each ball into a small circle, place a portion of the potato stuffing in the center, and seal the edges.
Roll out the stuffed dough ball into a paratha and cook on a hot griddle with ghee or oil until golden brown spots appear on both sides.

title: Chole Bhature
preparation: Soak chickpeas overnight. Pressure cook with salt until soft.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté chopped onions, ginger, garlic, and green chilies.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.
Add coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook the masala until oil separates.
Add cooked chickpeas and water if needed. Simmer until flavors meld.
For bhature, mix all-purpose flour, yogurt, salt, and a pinch of baking soda. Knead into a soft dough and let it rest.
Divide the dough into balls, roll out into discs, and deep fry until puffed and golden brown.

title: carrot halwa
ingredients: 1/2 cup chopped nuts (such as almonds, cashews, and pistachios)
preparation: Heat a heavy-bottomed pan or kadhai and add the grated carrots.
Saute the carrots over medium heat for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the milk to the pan and bring it to a simmer.
Cook the carrots in the milk, stirring occasionally, until the milk is reduced and thickened, and the carrots are soft and cooked through (about 30-40 minutes).
Add the sugar and mix well. Cook for another 10-15 minutes, stirring continuously, until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture thickens.
Add the ghee, chopped nuts, and cardamom powder. Mix well and cook for another 5-10 minutes.
Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
Garnish with saffron strands (if using) and serve warm.

title: ramen
ingredients: 4 cups of chicken or vegetable broth
2 cups chopped bok choy or spinach
Green onions and sesame seeds for garnish
preparation: In a large pot, bring the chicken or vegetable broth and water to a boil.
Add the soy sauce, miso paste, sesame oil, grated ginger, and minced garlic to the pot.
Reduce the heat to low and let the broth simmer for 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
While the broth is simmering, cook the ramen noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Add the sliced mushrooms and chopped bok choy or spinach to the broth. Cook for another 5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Divide the cooked noodles among serving bowls. Ladle the broth and vegetables over the noodles.
Top each bowl with a halved boiled egg, sliced green onions, and sesame seeds.
Serve hot and enjoy!
